Hello! I'm Ramiyan Gangatharan, a third-year student in the Computer Programming and Analysis program at Durham College. This site is part of a project for my Web Development Frameworks course, designed to showcase the skills and knowledge I've developed through my studies. Before enrolling at Durham College, I briefly pursued Software Engineering Technology at Centennial College. However, I chose to focus on a path that better aligned with my goals. My technical expertise spans various programming languages and frameworks, which Iâ€™ve applied across a range of projects. You can view some of my work on my portfolio site, including projects like MERN stack-based applications, .NET (C#), Java with JSP & Tomcat, and Python with API integration. I also spent time focusing on algorithms, data structures, and graph theory during breaks, which enhanced my problem-solving capabilities. In addition to my academic pursuits, I gained valuable experience as a Shift Supervisor at Tim Hortons from May 2023 to July 2024. I started as Counter Staff in November 2021 and worked my way up to Shift Supervisor, where I learned about team leadership, customer service, and operations management. While challenging, this role helped me developstrong social and leadership skills.
